title: Register auto-spawn hook during botbox init
description:
After botbus ships channel hooks (bd-2km in botbus), botbox init should register an auto-spawn hook so the project's dev agent starts automatically when messages arrive.

## What to register

```
bus hooks add --channel <project> \
  --if-claim-available "agent://<project>-dev" \
  --cwd <abs-repo-path> \
  -- bash scripts/dev-loop.sh <project> <project>-dev
```

- Only register if botbus is in the tools list
- Only register if bus binary supports hooks (check bus hooks --help or version)
- Use absolute repo path for --cwd
- Skip gracefully if bus doesn't support hooks yet (don't fail init)
- Idempotent: don't add duplicate hooks (check bus hooks list first)

- `botbox init` registers a hook for the project channel
- `bus hooks list` shows the hook with correct channel, claim guard, cwd, and command
- Running init twice doesn't create duplicate hooks

title: Add --actor to all br commands in workflow docs and scripts
description:
## Problem

All mutating br commands (create, update, close, comments add, dep add) support --actor <name> for the audit trail, but our workflow docs and scripts don't use it. This means all bead mutations are attributed to the OS username (bob) instead of the agent identity. Same issue with --owner on br create.

## What to change

### Workflow docs (packages/cli/docs/*.md)

Every br command in the docs should include --actor \$AGENT:
- br create --actor \$AGENT --owner \$AGENT ...
- br update --actor \$AGENT <id> ...
- br close --actor \$AGENT <id> ...
- br comments add --actor \$AGENT <id> "..."
- br dep add --actor \$AGENT ...

### Scripts (scripts/*.sh)

The inner prompts in agent-loop.sh, dev-loop.sh, and reviewer-loop.sh reference br commands. These should also include --actor \$AGENT (where \$AGENT is the agent's botbus identity).

### CLAUDE.md

The Beads section references br commands ‚Äî update those too.

## Notes

- --actor is available on all mutating br commands (create, update, close, comments add, dep add, dep remove)
- --owner on br create sets the owner field (distinct from actor which is the audit trail)
- For br create, use both: br create --actor \$AGENT --owner \$AGENT ...
- br comments add also has --author which overrides the comment author (distinct from --actor)
- For br comments add, use both: br comments add --actor \$AGENT --author \$AGENT <id> "..."
- Read-only commands (br show, br ready, br sync) don't need --actor

## Acceptance criteria

- All br create commands in docs include --actor \$AGENT --owner \$AGENT
- All br update/close commands include --actor \$AGENT
- All br comments add commands include --actor \$AGENT --author \$AGENT
- All br dep add/remove commands include --actor \$AGENT
- Scripts' inner prompts updated
- CLAUDE.md bead section updated

Current issue: dev-loop.sh pauses 60s between iterations to allow messages to arrive, but hooks now spawn agents on demand when messages arrive. The long pause just delays completion unnecessarily.

Current values:
- dev-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=60 (60 seconds)
- agent-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=5 (5 seconds)  
- reviewer-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=10 (10 seconds)

Proposed values:
- dev-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=2 (brief cooldown, not polling)
- agent-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=2 (consistent)
- reviewer-loop.sh: LOOP_PAUSE=2 (consistent)

Or eliminate entirely (LOOP_PAUSE=0)?

Changes needed:
1. Update defaults in loop scripts
2. Update defaults in .botbox.json config generation
3. Test: Agent completes faster without waiting unnecessarily

Rationale: The pause was for polling, but we don't poll anymore. Hook fires ‚Üí agent spawns ‚Üí does work ‚Üí exits quickly. Brief pause (1-2s) is just for rate limiting and letting stdout flush.

Testing: Run agent, verify it exits quickly when no work instead of waiting 60s.
